column4: how do I configure X for external connection? i want ppl. to connect to my pc
the login screen admin tool can let you enable remote tcp connections
nb: where is that?
System->Administration
fugitsu: only Login  window
ok I configured.. how they are able to connect now ?
that allows people to export X programs to your display - did you mean you want people to be able to view/control your desktop? If so it'd be System->Preferences->Remote desktop
ng: like remote desktop

ok in that case you probably want to disable the login screen option you just turned on, then pull up the Remote Desktop preferences and enable it (and probably set a password). People then just need a VNC client and your IP address to connect
ng: i want them to connect with they own users.. etc
in that case you'll either want XDMCP or Linux Terminal Server I think
also how do I connect to other computers?
connect how?
from my pc to thers..
I mean, do you want to connect via a command line, take control of their PC, establish a Terminal Server type connection or what?
take control of the pc
VNC is probably the easiest option
do I need to install`it?
they'll need to install a vnc server and you'll need a vnc client (vncviewer should be installed by default)
